title: Rear Suspension Units - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Install the suspension unit into position over the upper mounting.
Fit a new mounting bolt to the upper mounting and tighten to
Fit a new nut, the sleeve and the mounting bolt to the lower mounting and tighten to
Repeat steps 1 to 3 for the other rear suspension unit (if removed).
Remove the wheel support (if fitted), lower the motorcycle to the ground and park it on the side stand.
